title: Google\Cloud\ErrorReporting\V1beta1\ReportErrorsServiceClient
name: ReportErrorsServiceClient
description:
Service Description: An API for reporting error events.

EXPERIMENTAL: this client library class has not yet been declared beta. This class may change more frequently than those which have been declared beta or 1.0, including changes which break backwards compatibility.

This class provides the ability to make remote calls to the backing service through method calls that map to API methods. Sample code to get started:

try {
    $reportErrorsServiceClient = new ReportErrorsServiceClient();
    $formattedProjectName = ReportErrorsServiceClient::formatProjectName("[PROJECT]");
    $event = new ReportedErrorEvent();
    $response = $reportErrorsServiceClient->reportErrorEvent($formattedProjectName, $event);
} finally {
    $reportErrorsServiceClient->close();
}

Many parameters require resource names to be formatted in a particular way. To assist with these names, this class includes a format method for each type of name, and additionally a parse method to extract the individual identifiers contained within names that are returned.

Extends Google\Cloud\ErrorReporting\V1beta1\Gapic\ReportErrorsServiceGapicClient

methods.name: formatProjectName
methods.description:
Formats a string containing the fully-qualified path to represent a project resource.

Implemented in Google\Cloud\ErrorReporting\V1beta1\Gapic\ReportErrorsServiceGapicClient

methods.name: parseProjectFromProjectName
methods.description:
Parses the project from the given fully-qualified path which represents a project resource.

Implemented in Google\Cloud\ErrorReporting\V1beta1\Gapic\ReportErrorsServiceGapicClient

params.name: options
params.description: Optional. Options for configuring the service API wrapper.

params.name: options.serviceAddress
params.description: The domain name of the API remote host. Default 'clouderrorreporting.googleapis.com'.

params.name: options.port
params.description: The port on which to connect to the remote host. Default 443.

params.name: options.channel
params.description: A Channel object to be used by gRPC. If not specified, a channel will be constructed.

params.name: options.sslCreds
params.description: A ChannelCredentials object for use with an SSL-enabled channel. Default: a credentials object returned from \Grpc\ChannelCredentials::createSsl() NOTE: if the $channel optional argument is specified, then this argument is unused.

params.name: options.forceNewChannel
params.description: If true, this forces gRPC to create a new channel instead of using a persistent channel. Defaults to false. NOTE: if the $channel optional argument is specified, then this option is unused.

params.name: options.credentialsLoader
params.description: A CredentialsLoader object created using the Google\Auth library.

params.name: options.scopes
params.description: A string array of scopes to use when acquiring credentials. Defaults to the scopes for the Stackdriver Error Reporting API.

params.name: options.retryingOverride
params.description: An associative array of string => RetryOptions, where the keys are method names (e.g. 'createFoo'), that overrides default retrying settings. A value of null indicates that the method in question should not retry.

params.name: options.timeoutMillis
params.description: The timeout in milliseconds to use for calls that don't use retries. For calls that use retries, set the timeout in RetryOptions. Default: 30000 (30 seconds)

methods.name: reportErrorEvent
methods.description:
Report an individual error event.

This endpoint accepts either an OAuth token, or an API key for authentication. To use an API key, append it to the URL as the value of a key parameter. For example:

POST https://clouderrorreporting.googleapis.com/v1beta1/projects/example-project/events:report?key=123ABC456

Sample code:

try {
    $reportErrorsServiceClient = new ReportErrorsServiceClient();
    $formattedProjectName = ReportErrorsServiceClient::formatProjectName("[PROJECT]");
    $event = new ReportedErrorEvent();
    $response = $reportErrorsServiceClient->reportErrorEvent($formattedProjectName, $event);
} finally {
    $reportErrorsServiceClient->close();
}
Implemented in Google\Cloud\ErrorReporting\V1beta1\Gapic\ReportErrorsServiceGapicClient

params.name: projectName
params.description: [Required] The resource name of the Google Cloud Platform project. Written as projects/ plus the Google Cloud Platform project ID. Example: projects/my-project-123.

params.name: event
params.description: [Required] The error event to be reported.

params.name: optionalArgs.retrySettings
params.description: Retry settings to use for this call. If present, then $timeoutMillis is ignored.

params.name: optionalArgs.timeoutMillis
params.description: Timeout to use for this call. Only used if $retrySettings is not set.

methods.name: close
methods.description:
Initiates an orderly shutdown in which preexisting calls continue but new calls are immediately cancelled.

Implemented in Google\Cloud\ErrorReporting\V1beta1\Gapic\ReportErrorsServiceGapicClient
